comp3111.webscraper

Class WebScraper

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3111.webscraper.WebScraper

  • public class WebScraper
extends java.lang.Object
    Author: Lam Yiu Tung, Zhuoyu Yuan, Tai Ching Tai, kevinW WebScraper provide a sample code that scrape web content. After it is constructed, you can call the method scrape with a keyword, the client will go to the default url and parse the page by looking at the HTML DOM.
    In this particular sample code, it access to craigslist.org. You can directly search on an entry by typing the URL
    https://newyork.craigslist.org/search/sss?sort=rel&query=KEYWORD
    where KEYWORD is the keyword you want to search.
    Assume you are working on Chrome, paste the url into your browser and press F12 to load the source code of the HTML. You might be freak out if you have never seen a HTML source code before. Keep calm and move on. Press Ctrl-Shift-C (or CMD-Shift-C if you got a mac) and move your mouse cursor around, different part of the HTML code and the corresponding the HTML objects will be highlighted. Explore your HTML page from body → section class="page-container" → form id="searchform" → div class="content" → ul class="rows" → any one of the multiple li class="result-row" → p class="result-info". You might see something like this: 
     
    <p class="result-info">
        <span class="icon icon-star" role="button" title=
"save this post in your favorites list">
           <span class="screen-reader-text">favorite this post</span>
       </span>
       <time class="result-date" datetime="2018-06-21 01:58" title=
"Thu 21 Jun 01:58:44 AM">Jun 21</time>
       <a href=
"https://newyork.craigslist.org/que/clt/d/green-star-polyp-gsp-on-rock/6596253604.html" data-id
="6596253604" class=
"result-title hdrlnk">Green Star Polyp GSP on a rock frag</a>
       <span class="result-meta">
               <span class="result-price">$15</span>
               <span class="result-tags">
                   pic
                   <span class="maptag" data-pid="6596253604">map</span>
               </span>
               <span class="banish icon icon-trash" role="button">
                   <span class="screen-reader-text">hide this posting</span>
               </span>
           <span class="unbanish icon icon-trash red" role=
"button" aria-hidden="true"></span>
           <a href="#" class="restore-link">
               <span class="restore-narrow-text">restore</span>
               <span class="restore-wide-text">restore this posting</span>
           </a>
       </span>
   </p>

    The code 
     {
        @code
        List <? > items = (List <? >) page.getByXPath("//li[@class='result-row']");
 }
    extracts all result-row and stores the corresponding HTML elements to a list called items. Later in the loop it extracts the anchor tag ‹ a › to retrieve the display text (by .asText()) and the link (by .getHrefAttribute()). It also extracts

      • getPageHTML

        public int getPageHTML(java.lang.String defaulturl,
                       java.lang.String keyword)

        The method which can find the number of web page from the craigslist or dcfever
        Author: Lam Yiu Tung
        Parameters:
        defaulturl - - the url you want to search
        keyword - - the keyword you want to search
        Returns:
        the number of page that you search the keyword on the defaulturl(e.g. no connectivity)

      • scrape

        public java.util.List<Item> scrape(java.lang.String keyword)
        This method is used to return a list with the item information scraped from the two webs. It changes the format of date from String type (eg. Nov.1) to number (eg. 1/11) as well. Author: Lam Yiu Tung, Zhuoyu Yuan
        Parameters:
        keyword, - which user input to search the item.
        Returns:
        List ,An item list which contains the item information from two portals. A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found. exception Exception,Null if any exception (e.g. no connectivity)

      • scrapeFromDcfever

        public java.util.List<Item> scrapeFromDcfever(java.lang.String keyword,
                                              int nowpagenum)
        This method is used to return a list with the item information scraped from a page of DcFever.
        Author: Lam Yiu Tung, Zhuoyu Yuan
        Parameters:
        keyword,The - keyword which user input to search the item and the current page of the web, which is used to track the pagination.
        nowpagenum,the - page number that we want to search
        Returns:
        An item list which contains the item information from www.DcFever.com. A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found. exception Null if any exception (e.g. no connectivity)

      • scrapeFromCraiglist

        public java.util.List<Item> scrapeFromCraiglist(java.lang.String keyword,
                                                int nowpagenum)
        This method is used to return a list with the item information scraped from the Craiglist.
        Author: Lam Yiu Tung, Zhuoyu Yuan
        Parameters:
        keyword,The - keyword which user input to search the item and the current page of the web, which is used to track the pagination.
        nowpagenum,the - page number that we want to search
        Returns:
        An item list which contains the item information from the Craiglist. A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found. exception Null if any exception (e.g. no connectivity)

      • calRefineResult

        public java.util.List<Item> calRefineResult(java.util.List<Item> curResult,
                                            java.lang.String filterKeyword)
        This method is used to return a list with the filtered item information implemented by Refine Button.
        Author:Zhuoyu Yuan
        Parameters:
        curResult,The - current result list contained with information scraped from web and the keyword user input to filter the result.
        filterKeyword - ,the keyword that user want to refine
        Returns:
        List ,An item list which contains the filtered item information from previous search A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found.
